docs.text: Introduction ⚓︎ This document is intended as a guide for developers creating xApps for the dRAX platform, using the xApp Framework 2.2. Supported Versions ⚓︎ This version of the xApp Framework supports RIC 4.0 and up. Background ⚓︎ dRAX is Accelleran’s O-RAN aligned Cloud Native RAN platform. dRAX is cloud native by design and encompasses the O-RAN defined CU function, a Service Management and Orchestration (SMO) layer, as well as a near real-time RAN Intelligent Controller (RIC) platform. It features a micro-service oriented architecture with containerized functions orchestrated via Kubernetes and supports both 4G and 5G technologies. The dRAX RIC platform is a Near Real-Time platform. It allows developers to implement xApps that can leverage dRAX near real-time open RAN data and communicate with other xApps to bring new services and functionalities. It offers seamless integration with other orchestration platforms and lowers the technology barrier to implement Enterprise cellular networks by implementing artificial intelligence techniques for the configuration and operation of private cellular networks. This document serves as the developers guide in creating and deploying xApps on the Accelleran dRAX. To make the development and integration of xApps into dRAX as smooth as possible, we have created the dRAX xApp Framework. This framework consists of a number of predefined and pre-developed resources that can communicate with the rest of the entities within the dRAX RIC. This allows the framework to seamlessly integrate with dRAX on deployment. Using abstractions of the lower level details, the xApp Framework exposes easy to use methods which allows the developers to only focus on the functionality of their xApp. The dRAX xApp Framework consists of the following components, which are shown below: The xApp Library - a Python library which interfaces with the dRAX RIC platform The xApp Database - Redis server for storage of configuration data The xApp Core - the core logic of the xApp written by the developer The xApp Helm Chart - a Helm Chart used to deploy the xApp and integrate it with dRAX RIC
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Changelog ⚓︎ Added ⚓︎ Added xApp Library instead of the xApp Python Template. Instead of having template Python files, we now have a full xApp Python Library, which abstracts the interfaces towards dRAX and dRAX RIC. More info can be found in the xApp Framework In-depth and xApp Library In-depth . Added new xApp Configuration API. More information can be found in the xApp Configuration In-depth section. Changed ⚓︎ Updated the Workflows to add more options for easier development cycles. More info can be seen in the Quick guide , Development Workflows and Build your own xApp Dev Environment sections. As the new xApp Library is in place, all the previous abstractions of the interfaces are there, however, there are syntax changes. More info can be found in the xApp Library In-depth section. Updated the xApp API structure. More information can be found in the xApp Configuration In-depth section. The programmable approach to configuring the xApp has changed. More info can be found in the xApps Lifecycle In-depth section. The xApp Helm Chart has been updated to incorporate the changes above. More info can be found in the xApp Helm Chart In-Depth . Removed ⚓︎ The xApp API has been removed as a separate Docker image. It is now integrated in the xApp Library and part of the xApp Core. More information can be found in the xApp REST API section. Notes ⚓︎ In the Appendix: Conversion from the xApp Framework to the xApp Library section, we have summarized how to upgrade from the previous xApp Framework version 0.4.0 and 1.0.0 to the new 2.0.0.
docs.title: Changelog

docs.title: Notes

docs.text: Heartbeats ⚓︎ Description : Both the Layer 2 and Layer3 of each cell send out heartbeats to report that they are alive. The Layer 2 heartbeats has the following format: Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :** accelleran.drax.4g.ric.raw.service_discovery ` { "ENB": <string>, "ueDraxId": <string>, "ueRicId": <string>, "EnbL2ServiceHeartbeat": { "HeartbeatInfo": { "ComponentId": <string>, "DatastoreAvailable": <bool>, "Interval": <uint> } }, "tlpublishTime__": <string>, "timestamp": <int> } The Layer 3 heartbeats have a similar format: Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :** accelleran.drax.4g.ric.raw.service_discovery ` { "ENB": <string>, "ueDraxId": <string>, "ueRicId": <string>, "EnbL3ServiceHeartbeat": { "HeartbeatInfo": { "ComponentId": <string>, "DatastoreAvailable": <bool>, "Interval": <uint> } }, "tlpublishTime__": <string>, "timestamp": <int> } Network state ⚓︎ Description : This message publishes the network state of the eNodeB, cell and UEs connected to the cell. Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.4g.ric.raw.network_state { "configurationState": { "items": { "enb-id": "<uint32>", "local-cell-id": "<uint32>", "tracking-area-code": "<uint16>", "cell-id": "<uint32>", "good-one-pps-required": "<bool>", "admin-state": "<AdminState>", "op-state": "<OpState>", "rf-tx-status": "<RfTxStatus>", "physical-cell-id": "<uint16>", "downlink-earfcn": "<uint16>", "downlink-bandwidth": "<uint8>", "reference-signal-power": "<int8>", "frequency-band-indicator": "<FrequencyBandIndicator>", "prach-root-sequence-index": "<uint16>", "plmn-list": [ "<string>", ], "mme-set-list": [ "<string64>", ], "serial-number": "<string64>", "gnss-status": "<GnssStatus", "longitude": "<int32>", "latitude": "<int32>", "altitude": "<int32>" }, "ueState": { "items": { "inRange": { "items": <uint64> }, "servingCell": "<string>", "timestamp": <uint64> } } } } Enumeration description : Enum Type: AdminState Enum Values: locked unlocked Enum Type: OpState Enum Values: enabled disabled Enum Type: RfTxStatus Enum Values: on-air off-air Enum Type: FrequencyBandIndicator Enum Values: band-3 band-7 band-14 band-38 band-40 band-42 band-43 band-48 Enum Type: GnssStatus Enum Values: not-yet-available available UE Measurements ⚓︎ Description : If periodic reporting is enabled in the 4G Radio Controller, the UEs will be instructed to send periodic measurements. These measurements contain the RSRP and RSRQ value from the UE to its serving cell, as well as a maximum of 8 neighbouring cells. Each measurement to a specific cell is sent as a separate message. Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :** accelleran.drax.4g.ric.raw.ue_measurements ` { "ENB": <string>, "CELL": <string>, "UE": <string>, "ueDraxId": <string>, "ueRicId": <string>, "Rc4gUeMeasurement": { "UniqueRicId": <string>, "CellId": <string>, "AttachedCellId": <string>, "Rsrp": <uint>, "Rsrq": <uint>, "EllipsoidPointR10": { "EncodedAsn1Length": <uint>, "EncodedAsn1Body": <string> }, "EllipsoidPointWithAltitudeR10": { "EncodedAsn1Length": <uint>, "EncodedAsn1Body": <string> }, "HorizontalVelocityR10": { "EncodedAsn1Length": <uint>, "EncodedAsn1Body": <string> }, "GnssTodMsecR10": { "EncodedAsn1Length": <uint>, "EncodedAsn1Body": <string> } }, "tlpublishTime__": <string>, "timestamp": <int> } L2 Stats ⚓︎ Description : The dRAX RIC also reports the downlink and uplink L2 stats of the UEs in the network. Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :** accelleran.drax.4g.ric.raw.ue_measurements ` { "ENB": <string>, "CELL": <string>, "UE": <string>, "ueDraxId": <string>, "ueRicId": <string>, "EnbStatsL2StatsValues": { "Report": { "DschThroughput": <uint>, "UschThroughput": <uint>, "DownlinkBler": <uint>, "UplinkBler": <uint>, "TimingAdvance": <uint>, "UlSinr": <uint> } }, "tlpublishTime__": <string>, "timestamp": <int> } CQI ⚓︎ Description : The dRAX RIC also supports retrieving the CQI report of the UE to its serving cell. You can get the CQI value from each subband as well as the wideband CQI value. Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :** accelleran.drax.4g.ric.raw.ue_measurements ` { "ENB": <string>, "CELL": <string>, "UE": <string>, "ueDraxId": <string>, "ueRicId": <string>, "EnbStatsCqiReportValues": { "Report": { "WidebandCqi": <uint>, "CodeblockId": <uint>, "CqiList": { "0": <uint> }, "CqiListSize": <uint>, "RankIndication": <uint>, "TransmissionMode": <uint>, "UeEdge": <uint> } }, "tlpublishTime__": <string>, "timestamp": <int> }

docs.text: Beacons ⚓︎ DU beacon info ⚓︎ Description : This message gives information about the DUs connected to the CU-CP and their operational state (including [3GPP 38.473] served cell information). Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :** accelleran.drax.5g.ric.raw.cu_state ` { "DuBeaconInfo": { "DuList": { "items": { "0": { "GnbDuId": <string>, "State": "<DuState>", "ServedCellList": { "items": { "0": { "State": "<CellState>", "NrCgi": { "NrCellId": <string>, "PlmnId": { "Data": { "0": <uint> } } }, "Pci": <uint>, "FivegSTac": <string>, "SsPBCHBlockPower": <int>, "SupportedPlmns": { "items": { "0": { "PlmnIdentity": <string>, "TaiSlicedSupportList": { "items": { "0": { "SNssai": { "SST": <uint>, "SD": { "Data": { "0": <uint> } } } } } } } } } } } }, "GnbId": <string>, "DuName": <string>, "TransportLayerAddress": <string> } } } }, "tlpublishTime__": <string>, "spanContext__": <string> } Enumeration description : Enum Type: DuState Enum Values: NON_OPERATIONAL NON_OPERATIONAL_FAILURE OPERATIONAL Enum Type: CellState Enum Values: NOT_SUPPORTED ACTIVATING DEACTIVATING RESOURCE_UNAVAIL ACTIVATION_FAILED ACTIVATED CU-UP beacon info ⚓︎ Description : This message gives information about the CU-UPs connected to the CU-CP and their operation state. Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :** accelleran.drax.5g.ric.raw.cu_state ` { "CuupBeaconInfoData": { "CuupId": <string>, "State": "<CuupState>", "SupportedPlmns": { "items": { "0": { "PlmnIdentity": <string>, "TaiSlicedSupportList": { "items": { "0": { "SNssai": { "SST": <uint>, "SD": { "Data": { "0": <uint> } } } } } } } } }, "AdminState": "<AdminState>", "Version": <string>, "ExtraInfoList": { "items": { "0": { "Name": <string>, "Value": <string> } } }, "E1InterfacesList": { "items": { "0": { "IpAddress": <string> } } }, "GtpuInterfacesList": { "items": { "0": { "F1UAddress": <string>, "NgUAddress": <string> } } }, "CuUpName": <string> }, "tlpublishTime__": <string>, "spanContext__": <string> } Enumeration description : Enum Type: CuupState Enum Values: CUUPSTATE_NON_OPERATIONAL CUUPSTATE_NON_OPERATIONAL_FAILURE CUUPSTATE_OPERATIONAL Enum Type: AdminState Enum Values: Locked UnLocked AMF beacon info ⚓︎ Description : This message gives information about the AMFs connected to the CU-CP. Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :** accelleran.drax.5g.ric.raw.cu_state ` { "CuCpAmfBeaconInfo": { "GnbId": <uint>, "ServiceInfo": <string>, "AmfList": { "items": { "0": { "AmfName": <string>, "State": "<AmfState>", "AmfIpaddress": <string>, "SupportedPlmns": { "items": { "0": { "PlmnIdentity": { "Data": { "0": <uint> } }, "SliceSupportList": { "items": { "0": { "SNssai": { "SST": <uint>, "SD": { "Data": { "0": <uint> } } } } } } } } }, "AmfGuid": <string> } } } }, "tlpublishTime__": <string>, "spanContext__": <string> } Enumeration description : Enum Type: AmfState Enum Values: AMFSTATE_NOT_CONNECTED AMFSTATE_NOT_CONNECTED_FAILURE AMFSTATE_CONNECTED UE Measurements ⚓︎ Description : These measurements contain the RSRP and RSRQ periodic measurements from serving cell. Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :** accelleran.drax.5g.ric.raw.ue_measurements ` { "ENB": <string>, "DU": <string>, "CELL": <string>, "UE": <string>, "RrcMeasurementReportResultInfo": { "GnbCuCpUeId": <uint>, "Timestamp": <string>, "ServingCellInfo": { "NrCgi": { "NrCellId": <string>, "PlmnId": { "Data": { "0": <uint> } } }, "SsbRsrpResult": <uint>, "SsbRsrpResultPresent": <bool>, "SsbRsrqResult": <uint>, "SsbRsrqResultPresent": <bool>, "SsbSinrResult": <uint>, "SsbSinrResultPresent": <bool> }, "NumberOfIncludedCells": <uint>, "CellInfo": { "0": { "PhyCellId": <uint>, "NeighbourCellInfo": { "NrCgi": { "NrCellId": <string>, "PlmnId": { "Data": { "0": <uint> } } }, "SsbRsrpResult": <uint>, "SsbRsrpResultPresent": <bool>, "SsbRsrqResult": <uint>, "SsbRsrqResultPresent": <bool>, "SsbSinrResult": <uint>, "SsbSinrResultPresent": <bool> } } } }, "tlpublishTime__": <string>, "spanContext__": <string> } Processed Performance Measurements ⚓︎ CU Attempted RRC Connection Establishments ⚓︎ Description : Receipt of an RRCSetupRequest message by the gNB from the UE. RN_RELEASE_DUE_TO_PRE_EMPTION RN_MULTIPLE_LOC_RPT_REF_ID_INSTANCES CU Number of PDU sessions requested to setup ⚓︎ Description : Number of PDU sessions requested in NGInitialContextSetupRequest/NGPDUSessionResourceSetupRequest Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", // NRCGI converted to string "CounterId": "NUMBER_OF_PDU_SESSIONS_REQUESTED_TO_SETUP", "InstanceType": "CELL_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>", "SST": "<uint32>", // S-NSSAI SST "SD": "<uint32>", // S-NSSAI SD }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU DL GTP Throughput ⚓︎ Description : Measure of DL GTP data received during the reporting period in the observed cell. Data for all UEs (all PDU sessions) in a cell is aggregated. The reported DL_GTP_THP counter instance indicates total throughput and total samples (incremented one per second when the pdu session is active) for a UE Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", //CU-CP UE ID "CounterId": "DL_GTP_THP", "InstanceType": "UE_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<float32>", // THP value bytes per sec "CUCP_UE_ID": "<string>", //CU-CP UE ID }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU UL GTP Throughput ⚓︎ Description : Measure of UL GTP data received during the reporting period in the observed cell. Data for all UEs (all PDU sessions) in a cell is aggregated. The reported UL_GTP_THP counter instance indicates total throughput and total samples (incremented one per second when the pdu session is active) for a UE Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", //CU-CP UE ID "CounterId": "UL_GTP_THP", "InstanceType": "UE_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<float32>", // THP value bytes per sec "CUCP_UE_ID": "<string>", //CU-CP UE ID }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU Maximum number of RRC Connections ⚓︎ Description : Maximum number of users in RRC connected mode during each granularity period Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", // NRCGI converted to string "CounterId": "MAXIMUM_NUMBER_OF_RRC_CONNECTIONS", "InstanceType": "CELL_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>", }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU UL PDCP SDU loss rate (QOS) ⚓︎ Description : The fraction of PDCP SDU packets which are not successfully received at gNB-CU-UP. 1000000* Number of missing UL PDCP SNs of a DRB, divided by Total number of UL PDCP SNs. This value represents packets that are not delivered to higher layers. Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", // QFI "CounterId": "DRB_PACKET_LOSS_UL_QOS", "InstanceType": "QOS_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>", "QFI": "<string>", "CU_CP_UE_ID": "<uint32>", //CU-CP UE ID }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU UL PDCP SDU loss rate (S-NSSAI) ⚓︎ Description : The fraction of PDCP SDU packets which are not successfully received at gNB-CU-UP. 1000000* Number of missing UL PDCP SNs of a DRB, divided by Total number of UL PDCP SNs. This value represents packets that are not delivered to higher layers. Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", // S-NSSAI "CounterId": "DRB_PACKET_LOSS_UL_SNSSAI", "InstanceType": "SNSSAI_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>", "SST": "<uint32>", // S-NSSAI SST "SD": "<uint32>" // S-NSSAI SD }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU DL PDCP SDU drop rate (QOS) ⚓︎ Description : The fraction of PDCP SDU packets which are dropped on the downlink, due to high traffic load, traffic management etc. 1000000*Number of DL packets, for which no part has been transmitted over the F1-U or Xn-U or X2-U interface, of a data radio bearer, that are discarded in the PDCP layer, divided by Number of DL packets for data radio bearers that has entered PDCP upper SAP. Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", // QFI "CounterId": "DRB_PDCP_PACKET_DROP_RATE_DL_QOS", "InstanceType": "QOS_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>", "QFI": "<string>", "CU_CP_UE_ID": "<uint32>" //CU-CP UE ID }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU DL PDCP SDU drop rate (S-NSSAI) ⚓︎ Description : The fraction of PDCP SDU packets which are dropped on the downlink, due to high traffic load, traffic management etc. 1000000*Number of DL packets, for which no part has been transmitted over the F1-U or Xn-U or X2-U interface, of a data radio bearer, that are discarded in the PDCP layer, divided by Number of DL packets for data radio bearers that has entered PDCP upper SAP. Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", // S-NSSAI "CounterId": "DRB_PDCP_PACKET_DROP_RATE_DL_SNSSAI", "InstanceType": "SNSSAI_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>", "SST": "<uint32>", // S-NSSAI SST "SD": "<uint32>" // S-NSSAI SD }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU Packet Delay: Average delay DL in CU-UP (QOS) ⚓︎ Description : The average (arithmetic mean) PDCP SDU delay on the downlink within the gNB-CU-UP for all PDCP packets. Sum of (time when sending a PDCP SDU to the gNB-DU at the egress PDCP layer on F1-U/Xn-U, minus time of arrival of the same packet at NG-U ingress IP termination) divided by total number of PDCP SDUs arriving at NG-U ingress IP termination Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", "CounterId": "AVERAGE_DELAY_DL_IN_CUUP_QOS", "InstanceType": "NONE_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>", //Mean Delay in 0.1 millisecond "QFI": "<uint32>" }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU Packet Delay: Average delay DL in CU-UP (S-NSSAI) ⚓︎ Description : The average (arithmetic mean) PDCP SDU delay on the downlink within the gNB-CU-UP for all PDCP packets. Sum of (time when sending a PDCP SDU to the gNB-DU at the egress PDCP layer on F1-U/Xn-U, minus time of arrival of the same packet at NG-U ingress IP termination) divided by total number of PDCP SDUs arriving at NG-U ingress IP termination Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", "CounterId": "AVERAGE_DELAY_DL_IN_CUUP_SNSSAI", "InstanceType": "NONE_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<string>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>", // Mean Delay in 0.1 millisecond "SST": "<uint32>", // S-NSSAI SST "SD": "<uint32>" // S-NSSAI SD }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU SS RSRP Distribution per SSB ⚓︎ Description : This measurement provides the distribution of SS-RSRP per SSB (see TS 38.215) received by gNB from UEs in the cell when SS-RSRP is used for L1-RSRP as configured by reporting configurations as defined in TS 38.214, in case the L1-RSRP report function is enabled. Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters Reported RSRP value (range 0..127) Measured quantity value (L1 SS-RSRP) Bin0 127 >= -30 dBm Bin1 126..107 -31 dBm to -50dBm Bin2 106..87 -51 dBm to -70dBm Bin3 86..67 -71 dBm to -90 dBm Bin4 66..47 -91 dBm to -110 dBm Bin5 46..27 -111 dBm to -130 dBm Bin6 26..7 -131 dBm to -150 dBm Bin7 6..0 <= -150 dBm { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", // ssb frequency "CounterId": "SS_RSRP_DISTRIBUTION_PER_SSB", "InstanceType": "SSB_FREQ_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>", // count "bin": "<uint32>", // bin "ssb": "<string>", //ssb frequency }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU Packet Delay: Distribution of delay DL in CU-UP (QOS) ⚓︎ Description : The distribution of PDCP SDU delay on the downlink within the gNB-CU-UP, for all PDCP packets (time when sending a PDCP SDU to the gNB-DU at the egress PDCP layer on F1-U/Xn-U, minus time of arrival of the same packet at NG-U ingress IP termination) distributed in following bins Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters Bin Value bin0 <= 5ms bin1 6ms to 10ms bin2 11ms to 20ms bin3 21ms to 30ms .. bin10 91ms to 100ms bin11 101ms to 200ms bin12 201ms to 300ms .. bin19 901ms to 1000ms bin20 >1s to <=2s bin21 >2s to <=3s bin22 >3s to <=4s bin23 >4s to <=5s bin24 > 5s { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", // QFI "CounterId": "DISTRIBUTION_OF_DELAY_DL_IN_CUUP_QOS", "InstanceType": "QOS_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>", "bin": "<uint32>", "QFI": "<string>" }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU Packet Delay: Distribution of delay DL in CU-UP (S-NSSAI) ⚓︎ Description : The distribution of PDCP SDU delay on the downlink within the gNB-CU-UP, for all PDCP packets (time when sending a PDCP SDU to the gNB-DU at the egress PDCP layer on F1-U/Xn-U, minus time of arrival of the same packet at NG-U ingress IP termination) distributed in following bins Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters Bin Value bin0 <= 5ms bin1 6ms to 10ms bin2 11ms to 20ms bin3 21ms to 30ms .. bin10 91ms to 100ms bin11 101ms to 200ms bin12 201ms to 300ms .. bin19 901ms to 1000ms bin20 >1s to <=2s bin21 >2s to <=3s bin22 >3s to <=4s bin23 >4s to <=5s bin24 > 5s { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", // S-NSSAI "CounterId": "DISTRIBUTION_OF_DELAY_DL_IN_CUUP_SNSSAI", "InstanceType": "SNSSAI_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>", "bin": "<uint32>", "SST": "<uint32>", // S-NSSAI SST "SD": "<uint32>" // S-NSSAI SD }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU Handover Requests Counter ⚓︎ Description : Intra gNB counter incremented at both intra and inter DU handover. Incremented by one at sending of RRC Reconfiguration message to initiate the handover in the UE Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", "CounterId": "REQ_INTRA_GNB_HANDOVER_EXECUTIONS", "InstanceType": "CELL_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>" }, "timestamp": <uint64> } CU Successful Handover Counter ⚓︎ Description : Intra gNB counter incremented at both intra and inter DU handover. Incremented by one on reception of RRC Reconfiguration Complete. Also incremented by one if a successful reestablishment completes the handover Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", "CounterId": "SUCC_INTRA_GNB_HANDOVER_EXECUTIONS", "InstanceType": "CELL_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>" }, "timestamp": <uint64> } Raw Performance Measurements ⚓︎ RRC stats ⚓︎ Description : This message gives a list of raw PM counter values in CU-CP ` Enumeration description : CU-CP Throughput stats ⚓︎ Description : This message gives a list of DL/UL GTP throughput counters at CU-CP. Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :** accelleran.drax.5g.ric.raw.pm_counters ` { "PmReportingCucpCounterData": { "ReportingNodeId": <string>, "CounterList": { "items": { "0": { "CounterId": "<CucpCounterIdEnum>", "InstanceType": "<InstanceTypeEnum>", "InstanceId": <string>, "ValueList": { "items": { "0": { "_key": <uint>, "_val": <uint> } } } } } } }, "tlpublishTime__": <string>, "spanContext__": <string> } Enumeration description : Enum Type: CucpCounterIdEnum Enum Values: RRC_CONNECTION_EST_ATTEMPT RRC_CONNECTION_SUCC REQ_INTRA_GNB_HANDOVER_EXECUTIONS SUCC_INTRA_GNB_HANDOVER_EXECUTIONS MEAN_NUMBER_OF_RRC_CONNECTIONS MAXIMUM_NUMBER_OF_RRC_CONNECTIONS NUMBER_OF_PDU_SESSIONS_REQUESTED_TO_SETUP NUMBER_OF_PDU_SESSIONS_FAILED_TO_SETUP SS_RSRP_DISTRIBUTION_PER_SSB NUMBER_OF_CUCP_COUNTERS Enum Type: InstanceTypeEnum Enum Values: NONE_TYPE CELL_TYPE AMF_TYPE UE_TYPE UE_QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN_TYPE SSB_FREQ_TYPE QOS_TYPE SNSSAI_TYPE QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN_TYPE INVALID_TYPE CU-UP Throughput stats ⚓︎ Description : This message gives a list of DL/UL GTP throughput counters at CU-UP. Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :** accelleran.drax.5g.ric.raw.pm_counters ` { "PmReportingCuupCounterData": { "ReportingNodeId": <string>, "CounterList": { "items": { "0": { "CounterId": "<CuupCounterIdEnum>", "InstanceType": "<InstanceTypeEnum>", "InstanceId": <string>, "ValueList": { "items": { "0": { "_key": <uint>, "_val": <uint> } } } } } } }, "tlpublishTime__": <string>, "spanContext__": <string> } Enumeration description : Enum Type: InstanceTypeEnum Enum Values: NONE_TYPE CELL_TYPE AMF_TYPE UE_TYPE UE_QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN_TYPE SSB_FREQ_TYPE QOS_TYPE SNSSAI_TYPE QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN_TYPE INVALID_TYPE Enum Type: CuupCounterIdEnum Enum Values: DL_GTP_THP DL_GTP_THP_UE_QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN UL_GTP_THP UL_GTP_THP_UE_QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN DRB_PACKET_LOSS_UL_QOS DRB_PACKET_LOSS_UL_SNSSAI DRB_PACKET_LOSS_UL_QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN DRB_PDCP_PACKET_DROP_RATE_DL_QOS DRB_PDCP_PACKET_DROP_RATE_DL_SNSSAI DRB_PDCP_PACKET_DROP_RATE_DL_QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN AVERAGE_DELAY_DL_IN_CUUP_QOS AVERAGE_DELAY_DL_IN_CUUP_SNSSAI AVERAGE_DELAY_DL_IN_CUUP_QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN DISTRIBUTION_OF_DELAY_DL_IN_CUUP_QOS DISTRIBUTION_OF_DELAY_DL_IN_CUUP_SNSSAI DISTRIBUTION_OF_DELAY_DL_IN_CUUP_QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN NUMBER_OF_CUUP_COUNTERS CU-UP Handover Response ⚓︎ Description : This message contains a handover response from a CU Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :** accelleran.drax.5g.ric.raw.ran_control_response ` { "RIC_REQUESTOR": <string>, "RIC_INSTANCE": <string>, "E2apRanControlRsp": { "RicRequestorId": <uint>, "RicInstanceId": <uint>, "RicControlActionId": <uint>, "Timestamp": <string> }, "tlpublishTime__": <string>, "spanContext__": <string> }

docs.text: Description : The fraction of PDCP SDU packets which are not successfully received at gNB-CU-UP. 1000000* Number of missing UL PDCP SNs of a DRB, divided by Total number of UL PDCP SNs. docs.text: Description : The average (arithmetic mean) PDCP SDU delay on the downlink within the gNB-CU-UP for all PDCP packets. docs.text: Description : This measurement provides the distribution of SS-RSRP per SSB (see TS 38.215) received by gNB from UEs in the cell when SS-RSRP is used for L1-RSRP as configured by reporting configurations as defined in TS 38.214, in case the L1-RSRP report function is enabled. Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters Reported RSRP value (range 0..127) Measured quantity value (L1 SS-RSRP) Bin0 127 >= -30 dBm Bin1 126..107 -31 dBm to -50dBm Bin2 106..87 -51 dBm to -70dBm Bin3 86..67 -71 dBm to -90 dBm Bin4 66..47 -91 dBm to -110 dBm Bin5 46..27 -111 dBm to -130 dBm Bin6 26..7 -131 dBm to -150 dBm Bin7 6..0 <= -150 dBm { "PmCounterReport": { "InstanceId": "<string>", // ssb frequency "CounterId": "SS_RSRP_DISTRIBUTION_PER_SSB", "InstanceType": "SSB_FREQ_TYPE", "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>", "CounterValue": "<uint32>", // count "bin": "<uint32>", // bin "ssb": "<string>", //ssb frequency }, "timestamp": <uint64> }

docs.text: Protocol Documentation ⚓︎ genAccelleran5GTypes.proto ⚓︎ E1LinkPolicy ⚓︎ Groups parameters that define the policy relating to the use of E1 links. Field Type Label Description SctpPolicy SctpPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy for the use of SCTP on E1 links. F1CLinkPolicy ⚓︎ Groups parameters that define the policy relating to the use of F1-c links. Field Type Label Description SctpPolicy SctpPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy for the use of SCTP on F1-c links. NgCLinkPolicy ⚓︎ Groups parameters that define the policy relating to the use of NG-C links. Field Type Label Description SctpPolicy SctpPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy for the use of SCTP on NG-C links. NrCellGlobalIdentity ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description PlmnIdentity string optional NrCellIdentity uint64 optional ReportPollingConfig ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description TimerEnabled bool optional PduWithoutPollCountEnabled bool optional Timer uint32 optional NumPduWithoutPoll uint32 optional SNssai ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description Sst Sst optional Slice/Service Type. Sd uint32 optional Slice Differentiator. SctpPolicy ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description InStreams uint32 optional The maximum number of inbound streams that will be accepted. OutStreams uint32 optional The number of outbound streams that will be requested. SsbMtc ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description SmtcPeriodicity SsbMtcPeriodicity optional SmtcOffset uint32 optional SSB transmission offset in subframes Duration uint32 optional SupportedPlmnSlices ⚓︎ Groups information about a PLMN and the set of slices supported by that PLMN. Field Type Label Description PlmnId string optional Identifies a PLMN. NbrOfSNssai uint32 optional automatically added field for "s-nssai" list SNssai SNssai repeated Identifies a slice that is supported by the PLMN. CellReselectionSubPriority ⚓︎ indicates a fractional value to be added to the value of cellReselectionPriority to obtain the absolute priority of the concerned carrier frequency for E-UTRA and NR Name Number Description o_2 0 0.2 o_4 1 0.4 o_6 2 0.6 o_8 3 0.8 CipheringAlgorithm ⚓︎ Type definition for 5G ciphering algorithms. Name Number Description nea0 0 NEA0, the null 5G ciphering algorithm. nea1 1 128-NEA1, the 128-bit SNOW 3G based 5G ciphering algorithm. nea2 2 128-NEA2, the 128-bit AES based 5G ciphering algorithm. nea3 3 128-NEA3, the 128-bit ZUC based 5G ciphering algorithm. EutraAllowedMeasurementBandwidth ⚓︎ The values mbw6, mbw15, mbw25, mbw50, mbw75, mbw100 indicate 6, 15, 25, 50, 75 and 100 resource blocks, respectively Name Number Description mbw6 0 mbw15 1 mbw25 2 mbw50 3 mbw75 4 mbw100 5 FilterCoefficient ⚓︎ Allowed values for filtering coefficient Name Number Description filter_coefficient_unknown 0 filter_coefficient_0 1 filter_coefficient_1 2 filter_coefficient_2 3 filter_coefficient_3 4 filter_coefficient_4 5 filter_coefficient_5 6 filter_coefficient_6 7 filter_coefficient_7 8 filter_coefficient_8 9 filter_coefficient_9 10 filter_coefficient_11 11 filter_coefficient_13 12 filter_coefficient_15 13 filter_coefficient_17 14 filter_coefficient_19 15 IntegrityAlgorithm ⚓︎ Type definition for 5G integrity algorithms. Name Number Description nia0 0 NIA0, the null 5G integrity algorithm. nia1 1 128-NIA1, the 128-bit SNOW 3G based 5G integrity algorithm. nia2 2 128-NIA2, the 128-bit AES based 5G integrity algorithm. nia3 3 128-NIA3, the 128-bit ZUC based 5G integrity algorithm. Label Description Address string optional IPv4 address of the endpoint Port uint32 optional Port number to be used when the endpoint is the destination. Ipv4Interface ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description Address string optional IPv4 address of the interface SubnetMask string optional Subnet mask to be used on the interface Gateway string optional IP address of the default gateway to be used on the interface VlanId uint32 optional Optional VLAN ID to be used on the interface SctpParameters ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description IpAddress string optional The destination IPv4 address to be used for an SCTP association. Port uint32 optional The destination port to be used for an SCTP association. InStreams uint32 optional The number of inbound SCTP streams the initiator will accept. OutStreams uint32 optional The number of outbound SCTP streams the initiator wishes to establish. The peer entity may respond indicating that the number of streams it can accept is lower. AdminState ⚓︎ Administrative state of a managed object. The value locked means that the managed object is not allowed to operate. The value ulocked means that the managed object is allowed to operate. Name Number Description Locked 0 UnLocked 1 AltitudeRef ⚓︎ Name Number Description Wgs84 0 Altitude is with respect to the WGS-84 geoid MslGeoId 1 Altitude is with respect to the mean sea level geoid CellReserved ⚓︎ Indicates whether or not a cell is reserved for use by UEs belonging to Access Class 11 or 15. Name Number Description Reserved 0 NotReserved 1 OpState ⚓︎ Operational state of a managed object. The value enabled means that the managed object is capable of operating normally. The value disabled means that the managed object is not capable of operating normally (e.g. due to a fault condition). Name Number Description Enabled 0 Disabled 1 RfTxStatus ⚓︎ The RF transmit status of a cell. The value on-air means that the cell is transmitting and is able to provide service. The value off-air means that cell is not transmitting and is therefore not providing service. Name Number Description OnAir 0 OffAir 1 genAccelleranInternal.proto ⚓︎ genAccelleranLteTypes.proto ⚓︎ AllowedMeasurementBandwidth ⚓︎ The values that can be used for the maximum allowed measurement bandwidth on a carrier frequency. Name Number Description mbw6 0 mbw15 1 mbw25 2 mbw50 3 mbw75 4 mbw100 5 DuplexMode ⚓︎ Indicates the duplex-mode of a cell. XpathItem repeated Carries max MAX_NUM_OF_XPATHS elements of type XpathItem FilterModeType ⚓︎ Specifies how you want filterinf done Name Number Description Filter_PREFIX 0 If the XPATH matches the beginning the filter will pass Filter_FULL 1 The XPATH must match exactly in order to pass Filter_LEAF 2 The XPATH must match exactly and the leaf must be matching in order to pass Filter_PREFIX_IGNORE_KEYS 3 If the XPATH matches the beginning the filter will pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Filter_FULL_IGNORE_KEYS 4 The XPATH must match exactly in order to pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Filter_LEAF_IGNORE_KEYS 5 The XPATH must match exactly and the leaf must be matching in order to pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Operation ⚓︎ Specifies what happend (Create Update Delete) Name Number Description Operation_UNKNOWN 0 The operation could not be determined Operation_CREATE 1 A create was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_UPDATE 2 An update was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_DELETE 3 A delete was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_ALL 4 value to indicate that all operations are good Origin ⚓︎ Specifies where the modification came from Name Number Description Origin_APP 0 Modification was done by the application Origin_NETCONF 1 Modification was done via NetConf genDSC.proto CuupName string optional Unique CU-UP identifier CuUpListData ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description items CuUpItemData repeated Carries max MAX_NUM_CU_UPS elements of type CuUpItemData CucpBeaconInfo ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description CucpId uint64 optional gNB id OR CUCP id State CucpState optional The current operational state of the CU-CP ServedPlmns PBF1apMsgData.ServedPlmnsData optional Current list of PLMNs served by this CU-CP AdminState PBAccGenTypes.AdminState optional NatsUrl string optional URL of the NATS server RedisIp string optional Value containing the ip addresss of Redis server RedisPort uint32 optional Redis port used by the CU-CP Version string optional Version of the CU-CP software ExtraInfoList ExtraInfoData optional GnbIdLength uint32 optional GNB id length AmfList AmfListData optional CuCpName string optional Unique name given to the CU-CP ExtraInfoData ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description items ExtraInfoItem repeated Carries max MAX_NUM_EXTRA_ITEMS elements of type ExtraInfoItem ExtraInfoItem ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description Name string optional Value string optional AmfState ⚓︎ enum that contains an overview of all AMF states as seen by CU-CP Name Number Description AMFSTATE_NOT_CONNECTED 0 AMFSTATE_NOT_CONNECTED_FAILURE 1 AMFSTATE_CONNECTED 2 CucpState ⚓︎ enum that contains an overview of all CU-CP states Name Number Description NON_OPERATIONAL 0 NON_OPERATIONAL_FAILURE 1 OPERATIONAL 2 CuupState ⚓︎ enum that contains an overview of all CU-UP states as seen by CU-CP Name Number Description CUUPSTATE_OPERATIONAL 0 CUUPSTATE_NON_OPERATIONAL_FAILURE 1 genFrameworkTypes.proto ⚓︎ CommonResult ⚓︎ Enumeration for common results Extra enumeration values can be added if needed Name Number Description RESULT_SUCCESS 0 Indicates a successful outcome of the requested operation RESULT_FAILURE 1 The operation failed any value returned by the call must be ignored RESULT_PARTIAL_SUCCESS 2 The callee indicates partial success. It is billateral knowledge between caller and callee to give meaning to this response RESULT_INPROGRESS 3 The callee indicates the recption of the request. Responses will be send asynchroniously RESULT_OTHER 4 It is billateral knowledge between caller and callee to give meaning to this response RESULT_NO_RESULTS 5 Indicates that no results where returnes, this is typically used in datastore operations RESULT_MAX 6 Place holder to indicate the maximun number of enum values. If a value is received that is higher than MAX, the result should be considered FAILURE GuidType ⚓︎ Enumeration for guid ids. Name Number Description GuidType_Invalid 0 GuidType_Enb 1 GuidType_Cell 2 GuidType_Ue 3 GuidType_CuUp 4 GuidType_Du 5 GuidType_Amf 6 GuidType_Ng 7 GuidType_Ric 8 GuidType_RicInst 9 ServiceType ⚓︎ enum that contains an overview of all service types used by beacon module Name Number Description SERVICETYPE_INVALID 0 SERVICETYPE_LAYER2 1 SERVICETYPE_LAYER3 2 SERVICETYPE_ORAN 3 SERVICETYPE_ENODEB 4 SERVICETYPE_CUCP 5 genGNBCUCPTypes.proto ⚓︎ GnbCuCp ⚓︎ Grouping for the class representing a gNB-CU-CP. Field Type Label Description GnbId uint32 optional The gNB ID part of the Global gNB ID. PlmnId string optional 5 or 6 digit PLMN code (MCC and MNC) of the PLMN to which the gNB belongs. Forms part of the gNB's Global gNB ID as used in NGAP messages. GnbIdLength uint32 optional The length of the bit string representation of the gNB ID. GnbCuCpName string optional Human readable name of the gNB-CU-CP. If configured, this is sent to a gNB-CU-UP, gNB-DU and AMF during the E1, F1 and NG Setup procedures respectively. AdminState PBAccGenTypes.AdminState optional Administrative state. Value 'unlocked' means that the gNB is permitted to serve users. Value 'locked' means that the gNB is prohibited from serving users. In the 'locked' state, all of the gNB's cells will be off air. RlcMode PBAcc5GTypes.RlcMode optional Contains RLC mode entity value. OpState PBAccGenTypes.OpState optional Operational state. Value 'disabled' means that the gNB is totally inoperable and unable to provide service to users. Value 'enabled' means that the gNB is partially or fully operable and available for use. NbrOfAllowedCipheringAlgorithm uint32 optional automatically added field for "allowed-ciphering-algorithm" list AllowedCipheringAlgorithm PBAcc5GTypes.CipheringAlgorithm repeated List of 5G ciphering algorithms allowed to be used in the gNB, in decreasing order of preference, i.e. most preferred algorithm first. If nea0 is included, it should be the last entry in the list. Ciphering algorithms that are not supported by the gNB must not be included in the list. NbrOfAllowedIntegrityAlgorithm uint32 optional automatically added field for "allowed-integrity-algorithm" list AllowedIntegrityAlgorithm PBAcc5GTypes.IntegrityAlgorithm repeated List of 5G integrity algorithms allowed to be used in the gNB, in decreasing order of preference, i.e. most preferred algorithm first. nia0 should only be included in deployments where support of unauthenticated emergency calling is a regulatory requirement, and should be the last entry in the list. Integrity algorithms that are not supported by the gNB must not be included in the list. E1LinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.E1LinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of SCTP on E1 interfaces. F1CLinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.F1CLinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of SCTP on F1-c interfaces. NbrOfOperator uint32 optional automatically added field for "operator" list Operator Operator repeated Data relating to an operator who makes use of the gNB's services and resources. There may be more than one operator in the case of RAN sharing. HandoverControl ⚓︎ Contains the configuration for RSRP triggered A3 events used for handover control Field Type Label Description Enabled bool optional Controls if the gNB-CU-CP configures measurement reports for handover and triggers handovers based on them. This does not affect the ability to trigger handover through external handover commands. ReportConfigA3Rsrp PBAccNrUeMeas.ReportConfigA3 optional NgCLink ⚓︎ Grouping for the class representing an NG-C link. Field Type Label Description DestAddress string optional IP address or FQDN of the AMF at the far end of the link. OpState PBAccGenTypes.OpState optional Value 'enabled' means that an SCTP association has been established and an NG Setup procedure has been successfully performed with the AMF at the far end of the link; otherwise the value is 'disabled'. DefaultAmf bool optional Corresponds to default AMF as specified in [3GPP 23.501] AmfName string optional This is the value of the AMF Name received in an NGAP message from the AMF at the far end of the link. Operator ⚓︎ Grouping for the class representing an operator of a gNB. Field Type Label Description OperatorId string optional A string that uniquely identifies the operator. NgCLinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.NgCLinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of NG-C links to AMFs belonging to the operator. NbrOfNgCLink uint32 optional automatically added field for "ng-c-link" list NgCLink NgCLink repeated Represents a logical link on the NG-C interface between the gNB-CU-CP and an AMF. genGNBCUUPTypes.proto ⚓︎ GnbCuUp ⚓︎ Represents a gNB-CU-UP. Field Type Label Description UpIntegrityProtectionEnabled bool optional Value true means that the CU-UP will activate integrity protection of DRBs if requested, subject to the specified integrity algorithm being supported; false means that it will not activate integrity protection of DRBs under any circumstances. This determines how the CU-UP handles receipt of a Security Indication IE with the Integrity Protection Indication IE set to 'required' or 'preferred', over E1. UpCipheringEnabled bool optional Value true means that the CU-UP will activate confidentiality protection of DRBs if requested, subject to the specified ciphering algorithm being supported; false means that it will not activate confidentiality protection of DRBs under any circumstances. This determines how the CU-UP handles receipt of a Security Indication IE with the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE set to 'required' or 'preferred', over E1. genGnbController.proto ⚓︎ docs.text: Defines parameters that are configurable for all A3 report configurations (other than those in report-config-common). Field Type Label Description A3Offset int32 optional The offset value to be used in an A3 report configuration. TriggerQuantity TriggerQuantity optional Indicates whether A3 is to be based on RSRP or RSRQ or SINR measurements. Hysteresis uint32 optional The hysteresis parameter used in the entering and leaving conditions for an A3 event triggered reporting condition. TimeToTrigger TimeToTrigger optional The time during which the conditions for an A3 event need to be met in order to trigger a measurement report.
docs.title: ReportConfigA3

docs.text: Defines parameters that are configurable for all reportConfigs. Field Type Label Description MaxReportCells uint32 optional The maximum number of neighbour cells to be reported in the Measurement Report message. ReportInterval ReportInterval optional The interval between periodic reports. Can be applied to triggerType 'event' as well as 'periodical'. ReportAmount ReportAmount optional The number of measurement reports required. Can be applied to triggerType 'event' as well as 'periodical'. FilterCoeffRsrp PBAcc5GTypes.FilterCoefficient optional Filter coefficient for RSRP measurements at the UE FilterCoeffRsrq PBAcc5GTypes.FilterCoefficient optional Filter coefficient for RSRQ measurements at the UE FilterCoeffSinr PBAcc5GTypes.FilterCoefficient optional Filter coefficient for SINR measurements at the UE
docs.title: ReportConfigCommon

docs.text: Field Type Label Description UserId string optional The UR-ID per [n.12] R2-SRR-02 conformant per section 2.2 of [n.18]. FccId string optional The FCC certification identifier of the CBSD. It is a string of up to 19 characters as described in [n.22] CbsdSerialNumber string optional A serial number assigned to the CBSD by the CBSD device manufacturer having a maximum length of 64 octets. This serial number shall be unique for every CBSD instance sharing the same value of fccId. Each CBSD has a single CBSD Antenna (Ref. definition in section 4) and has a single cbsdSerialNumber. CallSign string optional A device identifier provided by the FCC per [n.13]. CbsdCategory CbsdCategory optional Device Category of the CBSD. Allowed values are 'A' or 'B' as defined in Part 96 CbsdInfo CbsdInfo optional Information about this CBSD model. AirInterface AirInterfaceObject optional A data object that includes information on the air interface technology of the CBSD. InstallationParam InstallationParamObject optional A data object that includes information on CBSD installation. MeasurementCapabilities MeasurementCapabilitiesObject optional The array of string lists measurement reporting capabilities of the CBSD. The permitted enumerations are specified in [n.21]. GroupingParam GroupingParam optional An array of data objects that includes information on CBSD grouping. CpiSignatureData CpiSignatureData optional The CPI is vouching for the parameters included in this object. In addition, the digital signature for these parameters is included.
docs.title: RegistrationRequestObject

If not set or if zero it is valid for ever NoAvailbleChannelsRetry uint32 optional Time in seconds a Spectrum inquiry will to send out a new request if the latest response did not return channels DeregistrationTimeout uint32 optional Time in seconds a deregistration procedure can last RelinquishmentTimeout uint32 optional Time in seconds a relinquishment procedure can last RegistrationPendingRetry uint32 optional Time in seconds we will wait before we retry registration request after receing a reg_pending response SpectrumInquiryRetry uint32 optional Time in seconds we will wait before we retry spectrum inquiry request after receiving a server error HttpTimeout uint32 optional Time in seconds an HTTP request can last

docs.text: Contains information to create/delete a GTP tunnel for benchmark puropses Field Type Label Description PduSessionId uint32 optional The PDU Session will be created. Currently a PDU session can have only 1 tunnel TunnelId uint32 optional The tunnelId that will be created. Please not that MSB (most significant bit of the tunnel-id MUST be 0. It will be ignored anyway SimulatedDuIpAddress string optional The IPv4 address in dotted notation of the process that simulates the DU (downlink) SimulatedUpfIpAddress string optional The IPv4 address in dotted notation of the process that simulates the UPS (uplink)

docs.text: Specifies how you want filterinf done Name Number Description Filter_PREFIX 0 If the XPATH matches the beginning the filter will pass Filter_FULL 1 The XPATH must match exactly in order to pass Filter_LEAF 2 The XPATH must match exactly and the leaf must be matching in order to pass Filter_PREFIX_IGNORE_KEYS 3 If the XPATH matches the beginning the filter will pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Filter_FULL_IGNORE_KEYS 4 The XPATH must match exactly in order to pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Filter_LEAF_IGNORE_KEYS 5 The XPATH must match exactly and the leaf must be matching in order to pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes)
docs.title: FilterModeType

docs.text: Specifies what happend (Create Update Delete) Name Number Description Operation_UNKNOWN 0 The operation could not be determined Operation_CREATE 1 A create was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_UPDATE 2 An update was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_DELETE 3 A delete was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_ALL 4 value to indicate that all operations are good
docs.title: Operation

docs.text: Specifies where the modification came from Name Number Description Origin_APP 0 Modification was done by the application Origin_NETCONF 1 Modification was done via NetConf
docs.title: Origin

docs.text: Enumeration for common results Extra enumeration values can be added if needed Name Number Description RESULT_SUCCESS 0 Indicates a successful outcome of the requested operation RESULT_FAILURE 1 The operation failed any value returned by the call must be ignored RESULT_PARTIAL_SUCCESS 2 The callee indicates partial success. It is billateral knowledge between caller and callee to give meaning to this response RESULT_INPROGRESS 3 The callee indicates the recption of the request. Responses will be send asynchroniously RESULT_OTHER 4 It is billateral knowledge between caller and callee to give meaning to this response RESULT_NO_RESULTS 5 Indicates that no results where returnes, this is typically used in datastore operations RESULT_MAX 6 Place holder to indicate the maximun number of enum values. If a value is received that is higher than MAX, the result should be considered FAILURE
docs.title: CommonResult

docs.text: Grouping for the class representing a gNB-CU-CP. Field Type Label Description GnbId uint32 optional The gNB ID part of the Global gNB ID. PlmnId string optional 5 or 6 digit PLMN code (MCC and MNC) of the PLMN to which the gNB belongs. Forms part of the gNB's Global gNB ID as used in NGAP messages. GnbIdLength uint32 optional The length of the bit string representation of the gNB ID. GnbCuCpName string optional Human readable name of the gNB-CU-CP. If configured, this is sent to a gNB-CU-UP, gNB-DU and AMF during the E1, F1 and NG Setup procedures respectively. AdminState PBAccGenTypes.AdminState optional Administrative state. Value 'unlocked' means that the gNB is permitted to serve users. Value 'locked' means that the gNB is prohibited from serving users. In the 'locked' state, all of the gNB's cells will be off air. RlcMode PBAcc5GTypes.RlcMode optional Contains RLC mode entity value. OpState PBAccGenTypes.OpState optional Operational state. Value 'disabled' means that the gNB is totally inoperable and unable to provide service to users. Value 'enabled' means that the gNB is partially or fully operable and available for use. NbrOfAllowedCipheringAlgorithm uint32 optional automatically added field for "allowed-ciphering-algorithm" list AllowedCipheringAlgorithm PBAcc5GTypes.CipheringAlgorithm repeated List of 5G ciphering algorithms allowed to be used in the gNB, in decreasing order of preference, i.e. most preferred algorithm first. If nea0 is included, it should be the last entry in the list. Ciphering algorithms that are not supported by the gNB must not be included in the list. NbrOfAllowedIntegrityAlgorithm uint32 optional automatically added field for "allowed-integrity-algorithm" list AllowedIntegrityAlgorithm PBAcc5GTypes.IntegrityAlgorithm repeated List of 5G integrity algorithms allowed to be used in the gNB, in decreasing order of preference, i.e. most preferred algorithm first. nia0 should only be included in deployments where support of unauthenticated emergency calling is a regulatory requirement, and should be the last entry in the list. Integrity algorithms that are not supported by the gNB must not be included in the list. E1LinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.E1LinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of SCTP on E1 interfaces. F1CLinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.F1CLinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of SCTP on F1-c interfaces. NbrOfOperator uint32 optional automatically added field for "operator" list Operator Operator repeated Data relating to an operator who makes use of the gNB's services and resources. There may be more than one operator in the case of RAN sharing.
docs.title: GnbCuCp

docs.text: Contains the configuration for RSRP triggered A3 events used for handover control Field Type Label Description Enabled bool optional Controls if the gNB-CU-CP configures measurement reports for handover and triggers handovers based on them. This does not affect the ability to trigger handover through external handover commands. ReportConfigA3Rsrp PBAccNrUeMeas.ReportConfigA3 optional
docs.title: HandoverControl

docs.text: Grouping for the class representing an NG-C link. Field Type Label Description DestAddress string optional IP address or FQDN of the AMF at the far end of the link. OpState PBAccGenTypes.OpState optional Value 'enabled' means that an SCTP association has been established and an NG Setup procedure has been successfully performed with the AMF at the far end of the link; otherwise the value is 'disabled'. DefaultAmf bool optional Corresponds to default AMF as specified in [3GPP 23.501] AmfName string optional This is the value of the AMF Name received in an NGAP message from the AMF at the far end of the link.
docs.title: NgCLink

docs.text: Grouping for the class representing an operator of a gNB. Field Type Label Description OperatorId string optional A string that uniquely identifies the operator. NgCLinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.NgCLinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of NG-C links to AMFs belonging to the operator. NbrOfNgCLink uint32 optional automatically added field for "ng-c-link" list NgCLink NgCLink repeated Represents a logical link on the NG-C interface between the gNB-CU-CP and an AMF.
docs.title: Operator

docs.text: Represents a gNB-CU-UP. Field Type Label Description UpIntegrityProtectionEnabled bool optional Value true means that the CU-UP will activate integrity protection of DRBs if requested, subject to the specified integrity algorithm being supported; false means that it will not activate integrity protection of DRBs under any circumstances. This determines how the CU-UP handles receipt of a Security Indication IE with the Integrity Protection Indication IE set to 'required' or 'preferred', over E1. UpCipheringEnabled bool optional Value true means that the CU-UP will activate confidentiality protection of DRBs if requested, subject to the specified ciphering algorithm being supported; false means that it will not activate confidentiality protection of DRBs under any circumstances. This determines how the CU-UP handles receipt of a Security Indication IE with the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE set to 'required' or 'preferred', over E1.
docs.title: GnbCuUp

docs.text: Gives general information of a UPS instance. This info will be used by the load balancer to add and remove BPF forward filters to the correct interface. Containers get assigned a virtual ethernet interface to communicate with the host. This interface has a Container part side and a host side. The info provided here is the host ide ifIndex. When the container send a packet it will ariive on the host side as an ingress packet so that we can apply XDP BPF programs to the packet Field Type Label Description IfIndex uint32 optional Host side part interface index of the Virtal Ethernet Interface of the container of the serving UPS InstanceId string optional

docs.text: Protocol Documentation ⚓︎ genAccelleran5GTypes.proto ⚓︎ E1LinkPolicy ⚓︎ Groups parameters that define the policy relating to the use of E1 links. Field Type Label Description SctpPolicy SctpPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy for the use of SCTP on E1 links. F1CLinkPolicy ⚓︎ Groups parameters that define the policy relating to the use of F1-c links. Field Type Label Description SctpPolicy SctpPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy for the use of SCTP on F1-c links. NgCLinkPolicy ⚓︎ Groups parameters that define the policy relating to the use of NG-C links. Field Type Label Description SctpPolicy SctpPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy for the use of SCTP on NG-C links. NrCellGlobalIdentity ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description PlmnIdentity string optional NrCellIdentity uint64 optional ReportPollingConfig ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description TimerEnabled bool optional PduWithoutPollCountEnabled bool optional Timer uint32 optional NumPduWithoutPoll uint32 optional SNssai ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description Sst Sst optional Slice/Service Type. Sd uint32 optional Slice Differentiator. SctpPolicy ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description InStreams uint32 optional The maximum number of inbound streams that will be accepted. OutStreams uint32 optional The number of outbound streams that will be requested. SsbMtc ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description SmtcPeriodicity SsbMtcPeriodicity optional SmtcOffset uint32 optional SSB transmission offset in subframes Duration uint32 optional SupportedPlmnSlices ⚓︎ Groups information about a PLMN and the set of slices supported by that PLMN. Field Type Label Description PlmnId string optional Identifies a PLMN. NbrOfSNssai uint32 optional automatically added field for "s-nssai" list SNssai SNssai repeated Identifies a slice that is supported by the PLMN. CellReselectionSubPriority ⚓︎ indicates a fractional value to be added to the value of cellReselectionPriority to obtain the absolute priority of the concerned carrier frequency for E-UTRA and NR Name Number Description o_2 0 0.2 o_4 1 0.4 o_6 2 0.6 o_8 3 0.8 CipheringAlgorithm ⚓︎ Type definition for 5G ciphering algorithms. Name Number Description nea0 0 NEA0, the null 5G ciphering algorithm. nea1 1 128-NEA1, the 128-bit SNOW 3G based 5G ciphering algorithm. nea2 2 128-NEA2, the 128-bit AES based 5G ciphering algorithm. nea3 3 128-NEA3, the 128-bit ZUC based 5G ciphering algorithm. Name Number Description nia0 0 NIA0, the null 5G integrity algorithm. nia1 1 128-NIA1, the 128-bit SNOW 3G based 5G integrity algorithm. nia2 2 128-NIA2, the 128-bit AES based 5G integrity algorithm. nia3 3 128-NIA3, the 128-bit ZUC based 5G integrity algorithm. Filter_PREFIX_IGNORE_KEYS 3 If the XPATH matches the beginning the filter will pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Filter_FULL_IGNORE_KEYS 4 The XPATH must match exactly in order to pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Filter_LEAF_IGNORE_KEYS 5 The XPATH must match exactly and the leaf must be matching in order to pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Operation ⚓︎ Specifies what happend (Create Update Delete) Name Number Description Operation_UNKNOWN 0 The operation could not be determined Operation_CREATE 1 A create was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_UPDATE 2 An update was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_DELETE 3 A delete was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_ALL 4 value to indicate that all operations are good Origin ⚓︎ Specifies where the modification came from Name Number Description Origin_APP 0 Modification was done by the application Origin_NETCONF 1 Modification was done via NetConf genDSC.proto CUUPSTATE_NON_OPERATIONAL_FAILURE 1 genGNBCUCPTypes.proto ⚓︎ AdmissionControl ⚓︎ Contains the configuration for RIC based UE/PDU session admission control Field Type Label Description RicUeAdmissionControlEnabled bool optional Send a message to the RIC to ask it for permission to admit a UE and wait for the response RicPduAdmissionControlEnabled bool optional Send a message to the RIC to ask it for permission to admit a PDU and wait for the response GnbCuCp ⚓︎ Grouping for the class representing a gNB-CU-CP. Field Type Label Description GnbId uint32 optional The gNB ID part of the Global gNB ID. PlmnId string optional 5 or 6 digit PLMN code (MCC and MNC) of the PLMN to which the gNB belongs. Forms part of the gNB's Global gNB ID as used in NGAP messages. GnbIdLength uint32 optional The length of the bit string representation of the gNB ID. GnbCuCpName string optional Human readable name of the gNB-CU-CP. If configured, this is sent to a gNB-CU-UP, gNB-DU and AMF during the E1, F1 and NG Setup procedures respectively. AdminState PBAccGenTypes.AdminState optional Administrative state. Value 'unlocked' means that the gNB is permitted to serve users. Value 'locked' means that the gNB is prohibited from serving users. In the 'locked' state, all of the gNB's cells will be off air. RlcMode PBAcc5GTypes.RlcMode optional Contains RLC mode entity value. OpState PBAccGenTypes.OpState optional Operational state. Value 'disabled' means that the gNB is totally inoperable and unable to provide service to users. Value 'enabled' means that the gNB is partially or fully operable and available for use. NbrOfAllowedCipheringAlgorithm uint32 optional automatically added field for "allowed-ciphering-algorithm" list AllowedCipheringAlgorithm PBAcc5GTypes.CipheringAlgorithm repeated List of 5G ciphering algorithms allowed to be used in the gNB, in decreasing order of preference, i.e. most preferred algorithm first. If nea0 is included, it should be the last entry in the list. Ciphering algorithms that are not supported by the gNB must not be included in the list. NbrOfAllowedIntegrityAlgorithm uint32 optional automatically added field for "allowed-integrity-algorithm" list AllowedIntegrityAlgorithm PBAcc5GTypes.IntegrityAlgorithm repeated List of 5G integrity algorithms allowed to be used in the gNB, in decreasing order of preference, i.e. most preferred algorithm first. nia0 should only be included in deployments where support of unauthenticated emergency calling is a regulatory requirement, and should be the last entry in the list. Integrity algorithms that are not supported by the gNB must not be included in the list. E1LinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.E1LinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of SCTP on E1 interfaces. F1CLinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.F1CLinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of SCTP on F1-c interfaces. NbrOfOperator uint32 optional automatically added field for "operator" list Operator Operator repeated Data relating to an operator who makes use of the gNB's services and resources. There may be more than one operator in the case of RAN sharing. HandoverControl ⚓︎ Contains the configuration for RSRP triggered A3 events used for handover control Field Type Label Description Enabled bool optional Controls if the gNB-CU-CP configures measurement reports for handover and triggers handovers based on them. This does not affect the ability to trigger handover through external handover commands. ReportConfigA3Rsrp PBAccNrUeMeas.ReportConfigA3 optional NgCLink ⚓︎ Grouping for the class representing an NG-C link. Field Type Label Description DestAddress string optional IP address or FQDN of the AMF at the far end of the link. OpState PBAccGenTypes.OpState optional Value 'enabled' means that an SCTP association has been established and an NG Setup procedure has been successfully performed with the AMF at the far end of the link; otherwise the value is 'disabled'. DefaultAmf bool optional Corresponds to default AMF as specified in [3GPP 23.501] AmfName string optional This is the value of the AMF Name received in an NGAP message from the AMF at the far end of the link. Operator ⚓︎ Grouping for the class representing an operator of a gNB. Field Type Label Description OperatorId string optional A string that uniquely identifies the operator. NgCLinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.NgCLinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of NG-C links to AMFs belonging to the operator. NbrOfNgCLink uint32 optional automatically added field for "ng-c-link" list NgCLink NgCLink repeated Represents a logical link on the NG-C interface between the gNB-CU-CP and an AMF. genGNBCUUPTypes.proto ⚓︎ GnbCuUp ⚓︎ Represents a gNB-CU-UP. Field Type Label Description UpIntegrityProtectionEnabled bool optional Value true means that the CU-UP will activate integrity protection of DRBs if requested, subject to the specified integrity algorithm being supported; false means that it will not activate integrity protection of DRBs under any circumstances. This determines how the CU-UP handles receipt of a Security Indication IE with the Integrity Protection Indication IE set to 'required' or 'preferred', over E1. UpCipheringEnabled bool optional Value true means that the CU-UP will activate confidentiality protection of DRBs if requested, subject to the specified ciphering algorithm being supported; false means that it will not activate confidentiality protection of DRBs under any circumstances. This determines how the CU-UP handles receipt of a Security Indication IE with the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE set to 'required' or 'preferred', over E1. genGlobalData.proto ⚓︎ genTransportGeneralTestTypes.proto ⚓︎ RemoteService ⚓︎ A remote service represents an internet host. It has a hostname which must be in the format of an IPv4 address, a port number, an unsigned integer of 16 bits and a transport type (see transport-enum). It also has a leaf called prime which is of no use at all apart from using it throughout my tests Field Type Label Description Hostname string optional Specifies the hostname for the service Currently hostnames MUST be in the form of an IPv4 address as we do not support name resolving yet. This is just some BLABLA so I can create a comment for a field in a structure larger than 1 line to see how it gets rendered in the protobuf Port uint32 optional Specifies the port where the service can be reached Transport TransportEnum optional Specifies the transport protocol to use Prime DiscoveredEnumFromInteger optional A field containing a prime number represented as the discovered enum discovered-enum-from-integer VarSizeIntegerContainer ⚓︎ A var sized container carrying unsigned 32 bit integers. The maximum capacity of this container is set to 60000 but this is just a marker as the current implementation of var sized container does no take this limit into account Field Type Label Description items uint32 repeated Carries max 60000 elements of type uint32 DiscoveredEnumFromInteger ⚓︎ A discovered integer enumeration representing the first 8 primes. Please note that 1 is not a prime number. Name Number Description discovered_enum_from_integer_unknown 0 discovered_enum_from_integer_2 1 discovered_enum_from_integer_3 2 discovered_enum_from_integer_5 3 discovered_enum_from_integer_7 4 discovered_enum_from_integer_11 5 discovered_enum_from_integer_13 6 discovered_enum_from_integer_17 7 discovered_enum_from_integer_19 8 TestEnum ⚓︎ A first enumeration to test code generation for both messaging and datastore. Enumerations may have a default value. This is indicated by the spacial annotation "default-value". If default value is not specified the first element in the list of enumeration will be chosen Name Number Description TestEnum_v1 0 The first value for the test enum TestEnum_v2 1 The second value for the test enum TransportEnum ⚓︎ Enumeration that specifies the possible transport layers. Name Number Description Transport_udp 0 UDP transport layer Transport_tcp 1 TCP transport layer Transport_both 2 UDP or TCP transport layer genXlrnModelTypes.proto ⚓︎ MultiKeyGrouping ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description Leaf1 string optional Leaf2 string optional Leaf3 uint64 optional Leaf4 uint32 optional Leaf5 string optional LocalEnum ⚓︎ Name Number Description Names_Jos 0 Names_Eddy 1 Names_Charly 2 genXlrnTestTypes.proto ⚓︎ TestGrouping ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description GroupEnumLeaf TestEnumType optional GroupInt8Leaf int32 optional GroupString64Leaf string optional TestGroupingWithList ⚓︎ Field Type Label Description Name string optional NbrOfElements uint32 optional automatically added field for "elements" list Elements TestGrouping repeated test grouping elements contained in another grouping as a list TestEnumType ⚓︎ Name Number Description TestEnum_1 0 TestEnum_2 1 TestEnum_3 2 TestEnum_4 3 TestEnum_5 4 TestEnum_6 5 TestEnum_nbrOfEnumValues 6 Scalar Value Types ⚓︎ .proto Type Notes C++ Java Python Go C# PHP Ruby double double double float float64 double float Float float float float float float32 float float Float int32 Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers – if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead. int32 int int int32 int integer Bignum or Fixnum (as required) int64 Uses variable-length encoding. docs.text: Defines parameters that are configurable for all A3 report configurations (other than those in report-config-common). Field Type Label Description A3Offset int32 optional The offset value to be used in an A3 report configuration. TriggerQuantity TriggerQuantity optional Indicates whether A3 is to be based on RSRP or RSRQ or SINR measurements. Hysteresis uint32 optional The hysteresis parameter used in the entering and leaving conditions for an A3 event triggered reporting condition. TimeToTrigger TimeToTrigger optional The time during which the conditions for an A3 event need to be met in order to trigger a measurement report.
docs.title: ReportConfigA3

docs.text: Defines parameters that are configurable for all reportConfigs. Field Type Label Description MaxReportCells uint32 optional The maximum number of neighbour cells to be reported in the Measurement Report message. ReportInterval ReportInterval optional The interval between periodic reports. Can be applied to triggerType 'event' as well as 'periodical'. ReportAmount ReportAmount optional The number of measurement reports required. Can be applied to triggerType 'event' as well as 'periodical'. FilterCoeffRsrp PBAcc5GTypes.FilterCoefficient optional Filter coefficient for RSRP measurements at the UE FilterCoeffRsrq PBAcc5GTypes.FilterCoefficient optional Filter coefficient for RSRQ measurements at the UE FilterCoeffSinr PBAcc5GTypes.FilterCoefficient optional Filter coefficient for SINR measurements at the UE

docs.text: Field Type Label Description UserId string optional The UR-ID per [n.12] R2-SRR-02 conformant per section 2.2 of [n.18]. FccId string optional The FCC certification identifier of the CBSD. It is a string of up to 19 characters as described in [n.22] CbsdSerialNumber string optional A serial number assigned to the CBSD by the CBSD device manufacturer having a maximum length of 64 octets. This serial number shall be unique for every CBSD instance sharing the same value of fccId. Each CBSD has a single CBSD Antenna (Ref. definition in section 4) and has a single cbsdSerialNumber. CallSign string optional A device identifier provided by the FCC per [n.13]. CbsdCategory CbsdCategory optional Device Category of the CBSD. Allowed values are 'A' or 'B' as defined in Part 96 CbsdInfo CbsdInfo optional Information about this CBSD model. AirInterface AirInterfaceObject optional A data object that includes information on the air interface technology of the CBSD. InstallationParam InstallationParamObject optional A data object that includes information on CBSD installation. MeasurementCapabilities MeasurementCapabilitiesObject optional The array of string lists measurement reporting capabilities of the CBSD. The permitted enumerations are specified in [n.21]. GroupingParam GroupingParam optional An array of data objects that includes information on CBSD grouping. CpiSignatureData CpiSignatureData optional The CPI is vouching for the parameters included in this object. In addition, the digital signature for these parameters is included.
docs.title: RegistrationRequestObject

docs.text: Contains information to create/delete a GTP tunnel for benchmark puropses Field Type Label Description PduSessionId uint32 optional The PDU Session will be created. Currently a PDU session can have only 1 tunnel TunnelId uint32 optional The tunnelId that will be created. Please not that MSB (most significant bit of the tunnel-id MUST be 0. It will be ignored anyway SimulatedDuIpAddress string optional The IPv4 address in dotted notation of the process that simulates the DU (downlink) SimulatedUpfIpAddress string optional The IPv4 address in dotted notation of the process that simulates the UPS (uplink)
docs.title: PduSessionCreateInfo

docs.text: Contains information to create/delete a GTP tunnel for benchmark puropses Field Type Label Description PduSessionId uint32 optional The pduSessionId that will be deleted. docs.text: Specifies how you want filterinf done Name Number Description Filter_PREFIX 0 If the XPATH matches the beginning the filter will pass Filter_FULL 1 The XPATH must match exactly in order to pass Filter_LEAF 2 The XPATH must match exactly and the leaf must be matching in order to pass Filter_PREFIX_IGNORE_KEYS 3 If the XPATH matches the beginning the filter will pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Filter_FULL_IGNORE_KEYS 4 The XPATH must match exactly in order to pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Filter_LEAF_IGNORE_KEYS 5 The XPATH must match exactly and the leaf must be matching in order to pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes)
docs.title: FilterModeType

docs.text: Specifies what happend (Create Update Delete) Name Number Description Operation_UNKNOWN 0 The operation could not be determined Operation_CREATE 1 A create was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_UPDATE 2 An update was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_DELETE 3 A delete was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_ALL 4 value to indicate that all operations are good
docs.title: Operation

docs.text: Specifies where the modification came from Name Number Description Origin_APP 0 Modification was done by the application Origin_NETCONF 1 Modification was done via NetConf
docs.title: Origin

docs.title: AdmissionControl

docs.text: Grouping for the class representing a gNB-CU-CP. Field Type Label Description GnbId uint32 optional The gNB ID part of the Global gNB ID. PlmnId string optional 5 or 6 digit PLMN code (MCC and MNC) of the PLMN to which the gNB belongs. Forms part of the gNB's Global gNB ID as used in NGAP messages. GnbIdLength uint32 optional The length of the bit string representation of the gNB ID. GnbCuCpName string optional Human readable name of the gNB-CU-CP. If configured, this is sent to a gNB-CU-UP, gNB-DU and AMF during the E1, F1 and NG Setup procedures respectively. AdminState PBAccGenTypes.AdminState optional Administrative state. Value 'unlocked' means that the gNB is permitted to serve users. Value 'locked' means that the gNB is prohibited from serving users. In the 'locked' state, all of the gNB's cells will be off air. RlcMode PBAcc5GTypes.RlcMode optional Contains RLC mode entity value. OpState PBAccGenTypes.OpState optional Operational state. Value 'disabled' means that the gNB is totally inoperable and unable to provide service to users. Value 'enabled' means that the gNB is partially or fully operable and available for use. NbrOfAllowedCipheringAlgorithm uint32 optional automatically added field for "allowed-ciphering-algorithm" list AllowedCipheringAlgorithm PBAcc5GTypes.CipheringAlgorithm repeated List of 5G ciphering algorithms allowed to be used in the gNB, in decreasing order of preference, i.e. most preferred algorithm first. If nea0 is included, it should be the last entry in the list. Ciphering algorithms that are not supported by the gNB must not be included in the list. NbrOfAllowedIntegrityAlgorithm uint32 optional automatically added field for "allowed-integrity-algorithm" list AllowedIntegrityAlgorithm PBAcc5GTypes.IntegrityAlgorithm repeated List of 5G integrity algorithms allowed to be used in the gNB, in decreasing order of preference, i.e. most preferred algorithm first. nia0 should only be included in deployments where support of unauthenticated emergency calling is a regulatory requirement, and should be the last entry in the list. Integrity algorithms that are not supported by the gNB must not be included in the list. E1LinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.E1LinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of SCTP on E1 interfaces. F1CLinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.F1CLinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of SCTP on F1-c interfaces. NbrOfOperator uint32 optional automatically added field for "operator" list Operator Operator repeated Data relating to an operator who makes use of the gNB's services and resources. There may be more than one operator in the case of RAN sharing.
docs.title: GnbCuCp

docs.text: Contains the configuration for RSRP triggered A3 events used for handover control Field Type Label Description Enabled bool optional Controls if the gNB-CU-CP configures measurement reports for handover and triggers handovers based on them. This does not affect the ability to trigger handover through external handover commands. ReportConfigA3Rsrp PBAccNrUeMeas.ReportConfigA3 optional
docs.title: HandoverControl

docs.text: Grouping for the class representing an NG-C link. Field Type Label Description DestAddress string optional IP address or FQDN of the AMF at the far end of the link. OpState PBAccGenTypes.OpState optional Value 'enabled' means that an SCTP association has been established and an NG Setup procedure has been successfully performed with the AMF at the far end of the link; otherwise the value is 'disabled'. DefaultAmf bool optional Corresponds to default AMF as specified in [3GPP 23.501] AmfName string optional This is the value of the AMF Name received in an NGAP message from the AMF at the far end of the link.
docs.title: NgCLink

docs.text: Grouping for the class representing an operator of a gNB. Field Type Label Description OperatorId string optional A string that uniquely identifies the operator. NgCLinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.NgCLinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of NG-C links to AMFs belonging to the operator. NbrOfNgCLink uint32 optional automatically added field for "ng-c-link" list NgCLink NgCLink repeated Represents a logical link on the NG-C interface between the gNB-CU-CP and an AMF.
docs.title: Operator

docs.text: Represents a gNB-CU-UP. Field Type Label Description UpIntegrityProtectionEnabled bool optional Value true means that the CU-UP will activate integrity protection of DRBs if requested, subject to the specified integrity algorithm being supported; false means that it will not activate integrity protection of DRBs under any circumstances. This determines how the CU-UP handles receipt of a Security Indication IE with the Integrity Protection Indication IE set to 'required' or 'preferred', over E1. UpCipheringEnabled bool optional Value true means that the CU-UP will activate confidentiality protection of DRBs if requested, subject to the specified ciphering algorithm being supported; false means that it will not activate confidentiality protection of DRBs under any circumstances. This determines how the CU-UP handles receipt of a Security Indication IE with the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE set to 'required' or 'preferred', over E1.
docs.title: GnbCuUp

docs.text: A var sized container is only defined in yang files for messaging ads they are not known to the datastore. This structure mimics the fact that a var sized container can use complex types from different modules. Also note the cardinality.
